intro: Leucantha iberica, commonly known as the Iberian leucantha, is a rare flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in shaded, moist environments such as woodland areas and stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
